title.value: GRouNdGAN: GRN-guided simulation of single-cell RNA-seq data using causal generative adversarial networks
title.justification: This is the official title of the paper as mentioned at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: GRouNdGAN: GRN-guided simulation of single-cell RNA-seq data using causal generative adversarial networks

extractions.description: The paper introduces GRouNdGAN, a gene regulatory network (GRN)-guided causal implicit generative model for simulating single-cell RNA-seq data. The model is capable of generating realistic cells while incorporating user-defined GRNs to preserve biological properties and dynamics such as gene identities, cell trajectories, and pseudo-time ordering.

type.justification: The paper presents the design, training, and evaluation of a new generative model using experiments on real datasets to validate its performance.
type.quote: We trained GRouNdGAN on three datasets.

name.justification: The paper mainly deals with simulating single-cell RNA-seq data, preserving biological conditions like gene regulatory networks.
name.quote: GRouNdGAN, a gene regulatory network (GRN)-guided causal implicit generative model for simulating single-cell RNA-seq data.

name.justification: The paper specifically focuses on simulating data guided by gene regulatory networks.
name.quote: Given an input GRN and a reference dataset, it can be trained to generate simulated data that is both indistinguishable from the reference data and faithful to the causal regulatory interactions of the input GRN.

name.justification: The model introduced is a type of GAN specialized for causal simulation of single-cell data.
name.quote: GRouNdGAN is a deep learning model that generates scRNA-seq data while imposing a user-defined causal GRN to describe the regulatory relationships of the genes and TFs.

name.justification: The research applies machine learning techniques, specifically GANs, to solve biological data simulation problems.
name.quote: GRouNdGAN is a causal implicit generative model for GRN-guided simulation of scRNA-seq data inspired by CausalGAN.

name.justification: GRouNdGAN is the central model introduced and discussed in the paper.
name.quote: We introduce GRouNdGAN, a gene regulatory network (GRN)-guided causal implicit generative model for simulating single-cell RNA-seq data, in-silico perturbation experiments, and benchmarking GRN inference methods.

is_contributed.justification: The paper presents GRouNdGAN as a novel contribution.
is_contributed.quote: We introduce GRouNdGAN, a gene regulatory network (GRN)-guided causal implicit generative model for simulating single-cell RNA-seq data.

is_executed.justification: The paper includes experiments and results obtained by executing the model.
is_executed.quote: We introduce GRouNdGAN, a gene regulatory network (GRN)-guided causal implicit generative model for simulating single-cell RNA-seq data.

is_compared.justification: GRouNdGAN is compared with other simulators like scGAN, cscGAN, scDESIGN2, and SPARsim in the paper.
is_compared.quote: Table 1 shows the performance of GRouNdGAN, control, and three state-of-the-art simulators for the PBMC-CTL dataset.

referenced_paper_title.justification: GRouNdGAN is proposed in the current paper itself.

name.justification: PBMC-All is one of the three primary datasets used in training and testing GRouNdGAN.
name.quote: The first dataset contained scRAN-seq profiles of 68579 human peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) from 10x Genomics corresponding to eleven cell types ('PBMC-All').

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper for the dataset is cited aside from its source from 10x Genomics.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The first dataset contained scRAN-seq profiles of 68579 human peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) from 10x Genomics.

name.justification: PBMC-CTL is one of the three primary datasets used in training and testing GRouNdGAN.
name.quote: We formed a dataset of the most common cell type in the PBMC-All dataset containing 20773 CD8+ Cytotoxic T-cells ('PBMC-CTL').

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper for the dataset is cited aside from its source from 10x Genomics.
referenced_paper_title.quote: We formed a dataset of the most common cell type in the PBMC-All dataset containing 20773 CD8+ Cytotoxic T-cells.

name.justification: BoneMarrow is one of the three primary datasets used in training and testing GRouNdGAN.
name.quote: Additionally, we obtained the scRNA-seq (MARS-seq) profile of 2730 cells corresponding to differentiation of hematopoietic stem cells to different lineages from mouse bone marrow ('BoneMarrow').

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific reference paper for the dataset is cited except its source from Gene Expression Omnibus.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Additionally, we obtained the scRNA-seq (MARS-seq) profile of 2730 cells corresponding to differentiation of hematopoietic stem cells to different lineages from mouse bone marrow ('BoneMarrow').

name.justification: Interactions with the PyTorch library are mentioned in the implementation of the model.
name.quote: Our implementation and evaluation of GRouNdGAN in Python 3.9.6 using the PyTorch framework60 along with a tutorial is freely available under the GNU Affero General Public License v3.0 on GitHub.

referenced_paper_title.value: Paszke, et al. (2019) PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper details the library used for the deep learning implementations in this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Paszke, A. et al. Pytorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library. Advances in neural information processing systems 32 (2019).
